description: Partnering to combat human trafficking through awareness and prevention. AbolitionNC has an awareness and prevention human trafficking student curriculum designed to align with requirements for 7th, 8th, and 9th grade health classes in NC. It includes training for facilitators. AbolitionNC provides an online school staff training module on child sexual abuse and child trafficking that aligns with the NC legal requirements and includes tracking and technical support. AbolitionNC has a documentary called, "Bring to Light: Unveiling Truth about Human Trafficking" which is available for showing at NC events.
specificPopulations: We primarily serve schools, youth organizations, and the general community
collaborationAndPartnerships: Various organizations in NC and beyond

topicsCovered: Community Training through our documentary showings

nonprofitName: Creative Counseling and Learning Solutions, PPLC/Dandelion Turtles
description: No matter where you are in life, we can help! We offer a wide variety of counseling and support services to people of all ages and backgrounds! From friendly talk to complex trauma, we will meet you where you are and develop a healthy relationship so that we can develop the tools to help you be the best you!

servicesOffered.description: At Creative Counseling and Learning Solutions, we offer Outpatient Trauma-Informed Therapy and Advocacy for all of our clients (including those that have experienced human trafficking). At Dandelion Turtles we will provide a residential therapeutic treatment facility for minors whom are victims of human trafficking, and/or sexual exploitation, Advocacy, Case Management, Crisis Support, Trainings, and etc

topicsCovered: Complex Trauma; Therapeutic Considerations for working with victims of complex trauma (including human trafficking); Human Trafficking 101; The Interrelationship Between Substance Use Disorders and Human Trafficking; and more based on request

description: We have a powerful team that Reaches, Rescues, and Restores Survivors of Human Trafficking. Through jail and hotel outreaches, and partnerships with law enforcement, Cry Freedom Missions locates survivors and helps them find safety at the Cry Freedom Missions Freedom Home which includes an emergency shelter, long term care program, and a transitional home. In 2019, Beverly Weeks, our CEO founded the Cry Freedom Missions Shoppe in Goldsboro NC to employ survivors and help fund the mission. In 2020, a satellite office opened in Sanford NC. In 2021, a shoppe and office opened in Roxboro NC. After being awarded a grant from the state in 2022, we expanded our Goldsboro location to include a coffee shoppe, Cafe, and a larger retail space. These shoppes are full of beautiful survivor-made jewelry, gifts, handbags, home decor, art, and more.

servicesOffered.description:
Description: Cry Freedom Missions is a non-profit organization with a mission to reach, rescue and restore survivors of human trafficking. We offer a range of services, including:
  • Rescue and Outreach: We conduct street and hotel outreach, operate a 24/7 hotline, and provide emergency rescue services for victims of human trafficking.
  • Safe Housing: Our safe house offers a secure, supportive environment where survivors can heal and rebuild their lives.
  • Case Management/Peer Support Specialists: Survivors receive individualized care, including trauma-informed support, recovery programs, and assistance with legal, medical, and counseling needs.
  • Vocational Training: Through our Shoppe, Cafe and Thrift Shoppe, we provide job training, internships, and employment opportunities to help survivors gain independence.
  • Outreach Center: We have an Outreach center for immediate needs like food, clothing, and resources for at-risk individuals.
  • Advocacy and Awareness: We raise awareness about human trafficking through community education, events, and partnerships, empowering others to join the fight against exploitation.
  • Transitional Independent Living: We offer a transitional independent living house (post gradation), where survivors can continue their journey through self sufficiency in a supported environment gaining life skills and personal growth as they move towards full independence.

collaborationAndPartnerships: State of NC Human Trafficking Commission

description: Empowering survivors of trafficking and exploitation to find hope for their lives and freedom for their futures. Daughters of Worth is the one of the only agencies in our area to provide services to both minors and adults.

servicesOffered.description: Prevention education, safety planning, assistance with safe exits, advocacy, case management, care coordination, emergency support, document recovery, trauma-informed mental health services, and survivor relocations

demographics: Other (We partner with Son’s of Honor as Advocates for boys under 18)

description: Designed For Joy provides women in crisis with stability through immediate transitional employment. These women may be emerging from substance use, homelessness, justice involvement, domestic situations, or human trafficking. We provide resources, encouragement, and a safe place to be. We envision a community where every woman has the opportunity to earn a competitive wage through dignified work.

serviceCategories: Other-Transitional employment services with case management
servicesOffered.description: Designed For Joy provides women in crisis with stability through immediate employment and support, removing the stigma of vulnerability. Our entry program is a 7 day work program where women get paid cash at the end of the day (hired as a contractor). Women work with our Care Manager from day 1 and proactively 3 weeks after they leave Designed For Joy. To make a referral, please reach out to formalize a partnership.

demographics: Other (We're a trauma informed workspace and serve all women emerging from crisis such as refugees, those in recovery, people emerging from general homelessness, and more)

We also provide programs for at-risk youth, and counseling and support groups for adults and children.

description: Dedicated to protecting, counseling, supporting, and empowering all individuals, children and families in Forsyth County, Family Services provides relief and response to critical community issues.

servicesOffered.description:
Family Services offers comprehensive support for individuals experiencing interpersonal violence.
  • 24/7 Emergency Shelter & Crisis Response for those actively fleeing violence.
  • Crisis Response Services including hospital accompaniment for SANE exams, law enforcement collaboration, and case management.
  • Long-Term Support through shelter-based and rapid rehousing case management.
  • Therapeutic Services offering short-term crisis therapy (3 sessions) and extended counseling options.
  • Legal Assistance for civil and criminal cases in partnership with Legal Aid of North Carolina through the Bridges to Hope program.
  • Community Domestic Violence Support Groups, Community Outreach and Education

description: For more than 80 years, Family Service of the Piedmont has been empowering individuals and families to restore hope, achieve stability and thrive through quality support services, advocacy and education.

servicesOffered.description: Family Service of the Piedmont provides support services for victims of domestic violence, rape, sexual assault, human trafficking, and other violent crimes.
servicesOffered.programs:
Programs: Victim Advocacy, Clara House and Carpenter House Shelters, Two Children’s Advocacy Centers,Domestic Violence Intervention Program
  • Services: Confidential crisis counseling, Assistance with the 50B restraining order process, Guidance in navigating the court system, Various support groups

Child Abuse & Healthy Parenting

  • Family Service of the Piedmont provides a range of services to support children and families who are experiencing or at risk of child abuse or neglect.
  • Educational programs to promote healthy parenting skills.
  • We are committed to supporting and educating parents to create safe, nurturing environments forchildren—an essential component of child abuse prevention.
  • Our organization operates two accredited Children’s Advocacy Centers, providing a child-friendlyspace where children who have experienced sexual or physical abuse or witnessed violence can sharetheir stories and begin the healing process.
Programs: Healthy Start, Fairview Family Resource Center
  • Services: Various support groups, Certified child victim advocates, Confidential counseling, In-home parenting education

Mental Health & Substance Abuse:


Family Service of the Piedmont provides professional therapy and counseling services for children, adolescents, and adults struggling with mental health challenges and substance use disorders. Our licensed therapists offer support for issues such as substance abuse, drug addiction, alcoholism, anger management, depression, anxiety, family stress, physical and sexual abuse, family dysfunction, grief, and marital concerns.
  • Services are available on a sliding fee scale, with costs as low as $0 based on income level. Medicaid isaccepted.
  • Clients without insurance can receive both primary care and behavioral/psychiatric care, while thosewith insurance have access to behavioral and psychiatric services.
Programs: High Point Center for Child Wellness, Integrated Care Program, Walk-in counseling clinics at Families First Center and Slane Center
  • Services: In-person and telehealth counseling, Substance abuse treatment and counseling,Trauma-focused care, Child psychiatry.

Financial Stability:


Family Service of the Piedmont’s Consumer Credit Counseling Service (CCCS) helps individuals and families achieve financial stability by providing guidance on budgeting, debt management, and homeownership. Our goal is to support clients in avoiding bankruptcy or foreclosure, reaching their financial goals, and regaining a sense of financial well-being.Services:Budget and credit counseling workshops, Debt management planning, Mortgage applicationassistance, Housing counseling, First-time homebuyer coaching, Foreclosure prevention, Reversemortgage counseling, Keys to Homeownership workshop, Student loan counseling.

Collaborate with City Leaders to find solutions for the growing homeless population.

description: Our mission at Gate Beautiful is to offer a clear path to men, women, and children caught in the snare of human trafficking, prostitution, or addiction by providing rapid response, case management and individualized restorative planning. We serve survivors primarily in the Relief and Stabilization phases of recovery. These first two phases of recovery are key in every survivor’s journey to healing. Our goal is to serve as an on-ramp to long-term healing. We do this through 24/7 Survivor Crisis Response, long-term case management, and personalized restoration planning. Once a survivor's basic needs have been met, our team works with them individually to create a restoration plan that fits their specific needs. Each survivor's long-term plan may look a little different depending on their specific needs, but our team is committed to creating a plan that will enable each and every survivor to walk into full freedom. Our goal is to provide a path, clear of obstacles, that enables survivors to walk into full recovery. We cannot walk the path for them, but we can help clear the way.

serviceCategories: Other-Court Mandated Diversion Classes for Sex Buyers
Gate Beautiful is authorized by North Carolina Department of Justice to make a human trafficking victim determination under 12 C.F.R.§1022.142(b)(i)(A)(2).

servicesOffered.description:
The Guilford County Family Justice Center (FJC) is a “one stop shop” for victims of domestic violence, sexual assault, child abuse, and elder abuse. At each of our Guilford County locations, professionals from 15 different disciplines work together to provide consolidated and coordinated safety, legal, social, and health services to individuals and families in need.

At the Centers, victims of domestic and sexual violence can come to one location to access a wide range of supportive resources, such as talking with a victim advocate, getting assistance with filing a restraining order, planning for their safety, talking to a law enforcement officer, meeting with a professional to discuss civil and criminal legal issues, receiving medical assistance, and gaining information on how to access shelter and other community resources.

The FJC is also a resource for community outreach, training, and education and works with organizations throughout the County, state and nationwide.

collaborationAndPartnerships: Children's Law Center of Central NC
Family Service of the Piedmont Adult Victim Advocacy and Child Advocacy Centers
Greensboro Police Department’s Family Victims Unit
Guilford County DHHS—Child and Adult Protective Services

Piedmont Triad Adult Area on Aging

description: Help, Incorporated seeks to improve the quality of life for victims of sexual assault, rape, domestic violence, and dating violence throughout their lifespan by providing holistic services delivered empathetically to empower victims to make decisions that will enhance safety, increase self-worth, promote positive change, and eventually lead to self-actualization; Enhance the community’s awareness of issues surrounding victimization, including the dispelling of myths, and promote collaborative community action efforts to stop victimization.
Bringing freedom from human trafficking.

servicesOffered.description: Hope for Justice (HFJ) is an international charity focused on ending human trafficking. The HFJ United States Operations is based out of Nashville, TN and employs U.S. investigators that are licensed private investigators who work with HFJ social service programs, other Non-Governmental Organizations (NGO), and local, state, and federal law enforcement to identify adult victims of sex and/or labor trafficking; build trust with them; and get them out of exploitation. HFJ has social service hubs in Nashville, TN, Charlotte, NC, and Iowa that provide diverse types of services to victims that include but are not limited to securing safe temporary housing, residential and non-residential treatment programs, and legal advocacy.

description: The Kellin Foundation’s mission is to strengthen resilience among children, families, adults and communities through trauma-informed behavioral health services focused on prevention, treatment, and healing. We provide free services that help clients break cycles of trauma that contribute to mental health and substance use challenges. Our team of highly-trained professionals helps people process what has happened to them, to practice new skills that contribute to healing, and to gain confidence that they can chart a different course for themselves and their families. To achieve our mission, we provide evidence-based, trauma-responsive counseling, peer support, advocacy, and case coordination services. In addition, we provide training and facilitate teams working together to build a stronger Guilford County.

servicesOffered.description: We provide free services that help clients break cycles of trauma that contribute to mental health and substance use challenges. To achieve our mission, we provide evidence-based, trauma-responsive counseling, peer support, advocacy, and case coordination services. In addition, we provide training and facilitate teams working together to build a stronger community.

servicesOffered.description: NCCASA Human Trafficking Program staff collaborates with NC state and local community partners in supporting and advocating for the needs of HT survivors and works with direct service providers to support and connect them with resources. Our training and technical assistance reflects the needs that rape crisis programs and members are sharing with us: what survivors need, and what programs need to best serve them. As rape crisis centers are increasingly called on to assist survivors of human trafficking, NCCASA’s anti-human trafficking work continues to focus on building capacity to better serve survivors. NCCASA is in coalition with all US states and territories to share resources and advocate for survivor needs.

description: Mike Chapman is a survivor of incestual childhood sexual abuse and family-controlled sexual trafficking (including ritual abuse & mind control), and a survivor of sexual assault by clergy as a young adult. In his spiritual journey to recovery, Mike has had to battle, among other things, anger, PTSD, anxiety, codependency, and addictive behaviors, including porn addiction. Mike is currently a Recovery Life Coach and Brainspotting Provider for both Polar Life Consulting and Husband Material. Mike also hosts his own podcast, "Healing for Male Survivors with Mike Chapman" where he interviews male survivors of sexual trauma and those who serve them, available on most platforms.

contacts.description: Certified Recovery Life Coach, Brainspotting Provider, Podcast Host, Lived Experience Expert/Consultant

Podcast Host where Survivors can find a safe place to share their story (anonymously, if desired). Faith-Based, but not Faith-Forced.

nonprofitName: Rape Crisis Volunteers of Cumberland County (Phoenix Center)
description: The mission of The Phoenix Center is to achieve zero tolerance for the crime of sexual and domestic violence and to reduce its trauma.
Our mission is to empower communities and individuals to identify and support survivors, ensuring that they have access to safe, quality housing and holistic care.

servicesOffered.description:
• Survivor Support Team: Safe House Project's Survivor Support Team serves hundreds of survivorsevery month exiting a trafficking situation and helping them get the services they need. ETo connectwith our Survivor Support Team, please call (507) 769-0819 and select option 1 or start the processsafehouseproject.org/refer
  • Travel Assistance: Safe House Project covers the costs of travel for the survivor and, if necessary, forlaw enforcement and/or a chaperone, ensuring safe and secure transportation to the placementlocation.
  • Out-of-State Minor Placements: We facilitate placements across state lines when necessary andmanage the Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children (ICPC) process, ensuring that minorsreceive the best possible care regardless of their location.
  • Program Vetting and Network Expansion: We thoroughly vet programs to ensure they meet our highstandards for care and welcome new programs to join our network. This ensures that survivors areplaced in facilities that provide safe, supportive, and effective care.
  • Cost-Free Services: Our survivor services and referral sources are provided at no cost to survivors,ensuring they can access critical support without financial barriers.
  • Training & Educational Resources:
    • Free Training - Available at IAmOnWatch.org
      OnWatch™ is a survivor-led training designed to empower you to spot, report, andprevent sex trafficking where you live, work, and play. Through true survivorexperiences, industry experts explain the key indicators of trafficking, as well ashow you can support a survivor’s path to freedom.
    • Healthcare Observations for the Prevention & Eradication of Human Trafficking Training
      The H.O.P.E. Training is a survivor-informed, trauma-informed, andpatient-centered, video-based training that equips all healthcare workers toidentify potential human trafficking victims, give support, and offer resources.Available at https://training.safehouseproject.org/
  • Safe House Project - 2025 LOI Open
    • We're thrilled to announce our enhanced funding initiative supporting organizations that providecritical housing services to trafficking survivors. Our focus this year? Expanding bed capacity andbreaking down access barriers to create more inclusive, sustainable housing solutions.
    • Important Update: All certified programs with projects aligned to our housing expansion goals willautomatically advance to the application phase (LOI submission still required). Certified programsalso have an abbreviated application.

topicsCovered: Just Ask Prevention Education: Programs designed for schools, organizations, and communities to recognize signs of trafficking and learn prevention strategies.

description: Shield NC prioritizes collaboration to combat human trafficking through empowerment, prevention and advocacy. If you would like to collaborate on a project or if you are interested in receiving training, please reach out. It will take us all working together to end this horrific crime!

servicesOffered.description: We offered specialized training to various groups and professions. We also advocate for effective policies and legislation on the local, state and federal levels. Other initiatives can be found on our website.
feesAndPaymentOptions: Other-We will request a donation in order to be able to continue to operate but all services are provided for free

collaborationAndPartnerships: We have collaborated with over 70 organizations! If you have an opportunity for collaboration or need support on an initiative, please reach out.

topicsCovered: We have created over 30 specialized trainings for specific groups and professions. In general, the topics we cover are: what human trafficking is and what it isn’t, myths, red flags specific to attendees group/profession, actions to take if a trafficking situation is suspected, statistics and research specific to group/profession, trauma-informed interactions with survivors, available resources, and other information specific to audiences.

description: Our mission is to empower survivors of human trafficking as they reclaim their lives and realize their fullest potential. Through a holistic approach that includes peer mentoring and coaching, professional development, mental health support, career-focused case management, and a thriving survivor community, we are dedicated to fostering hope, resilience, and self-sufficiency. We serve survivors who are ready to move beyond the trauma of exploitation and embarkon the next phase of recovery—a journey we call ‘real life.’

servicesOffered.description: We are a survivor-led non-profit that serves as a resource hub for the professional development of survivors of human traﬃcking. Our mission is to empower survivors by providing them with the necessary tools and resources to rebuild their lives and pursue their career goals. We believe that every survivor deserves the opportunity to reach their full potential and thrive in their chosen profession.

specificPopulations: Other-All Survivors of Human Trafficking who have been out of their trafficking situation for at least 18 months

description: Our mission is to empower and support all individuals who have experienced human trafficking by bridging the gaps between underserved communities, local services, and community awareness.

Survivors need multiple pathways to leave the life and access freedom - one size does not fit all. A point of exit is a relationship with an individual, a group, or an organization that provides safety, resources, and opportunities to move forward. These doorways to freedom may come though mental health counseling, a trauma-informed foster placement, or other transformative relationships they encounter along the way.

servicesOffered.description: The Hundred Movement offers free individual and group counseling services to survivors of sex trafficking. THM also offers individualized case management services to assist survivors in reaching their goals.

businessType: Other (Government Relations and Strategic Growth Consulting Firm)
description: At The Woolf Group, we want the public to know that our services are designed to create meaningful impact. We specialize in strategic advocacy, public policy consulting, and fundraising solutions that empower nonprofits, businesses, and government agencies to drive social change. Our approach is personalized and mission-driven, ensuring that every strategy we craft aligns with our clients' goals and values. We believe that effective advocacy and strategic partnerships can transform communities, and we are committed to helping our clients navigate complex legislative landscapes to make that transformation a reality. Ultimately, our success is measured by the positive impact we help create.

servicesOffered.description: The Woolf Group is a leading social impact and government relations firm specializing in strategic advocacy, public policy consulting, and fundraising solutions. We help nonprofits, businesses, and government agencies navigate complex legislative landscapes, secure funding, and drive mission-driven change. Our services include strategic planning, policy analysis, coalition building, congressional outreach, and securing earmarked funding. With a commitment to social impact and a personalized approach, we empower our clients to achieve their goals and make a meaningful difference.
